issue.body:
This is a grouping of related issues. Feel free to vote (ðŸ‘) for this issue to indicate that this is an area that you think we should spend time on, but consider also voting for individual issues for things you consider especially important.

body:
We had a phase where we discussed this... Back then I thought it wouldn't be possible, but I'm not sure any more.

The main problem here is that we need to extract parameters from lambdas in the various LINQ operators that make up the query:

```c#
x = context.Blogs.Where(b => b.Name = foo).ToList();
```

So Where would have to be replaced with something that actually goes and extracts the parameter value, populating it into a QueryContext that flows from the root. It's certainly not trivial stuff, but may be doable - and it would allow us to get compiled query perf (or very near it) with regular queries in code.

Definitely something we should think about.

Note: there's one specific query type which interceptors won't support - foreach over a DbSet property:

```c#
foreach (var blog in context.Blogs)
{
    ...
}
```

The workaround here would be for the user to add AsEnumerable(), which we'd then intercept. A precompilation analyzer could provide a codefix (#32727).

issue.title: Implement precompiled queries

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
The precompiled query work is in good enough shape that I think it's the right moment to submit as a draft PR. There are still various test failures, checks and cleanups which I plan to implement, but it's more about edge cases at this point - the overall architecture should be sound. I'm happy to do a session with whoever wants to dive in and at least explain the general approach (we can also do a brown bag at some point if people want to).

Notes:

* This PR is based on top of #32721 (liftable constants in shaper), which @maumar is working on (**take care to filter out the 1st commit when reviewing**). The shaper work must be complete for this PR to be completed.
* One main reason to submit this now, is to allow @AndriySvyryd to react:
    * LinqToCSharpSyntaxTranslator now generates unsafe accessors when it encounters private field/property accesses; @AndriySvyryd I think this can be used instead of the previous "method access replacements" approach for compiled model generation, where the unsafe accessors are pre-generated externally and then substituted in the overriding implementation.
    * Work can begin on integrating this into MSBuild.
* This is a pretty massive PR, implementing the bulk (and probably most complex parts) of precompiled queries; the more eyes on this, the better.

Closes #31331
